Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Arraignment as to Yeska Flores-Rivera (11) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 and Detention Hearing held on 8/23/2007. AUSA Elba Gorbea and CJA Robert Millan were present. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. PONG entered. Defendant remains under custody. Defense is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel agrees with the pretrial recommendation for bond and in which release conditions can be fashioned. The Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation and requested detention without bail. After hearing the parties, the Court finds defendant to be a risk of flight. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Order will follow. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Janis Palma, PO: Mari Carmen Rios) (br, ) (Entered: 08/23/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin :Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Lorraine Ortiz-Flores (18) held on 8/24/2007. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty entered as to Counts 1-7. The parties are granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. The government agreed with the recommendation made by Pretrial Services and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel argued in favor of setting conditions of release. The Court conditionally set bail at $10,000 secured, with drug testing and counseling, electronic monitoring, 3rd party custodian, plus all other standard conditions of release. Pretrial Services shall inform the Court if the defendant's father qualifies as a 3rd party custodian. The defendant shall be released if her father qualifies as 3rd party custodian and when the secured bond amount is posted. (AUSA Dina Avila. Atty for deft Carlos Calderon-Garnier. PTS Mari Carmen Rios. INT Janis Palma. CR FTR. CD Jyoti Mehta.) (jm, ) (Entered: 09/07/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin :Detention Hearing as to Angel Luis Neris-Ortiz held on 10/4/2007. AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Juan Alvarez-Cobian were present. The Government requested detention without bail pending trial, giving the amount of drugs involved in this case and consider defendant to be a risk of flight and danger to the community. Defense counsel had no evidence to rebut at this time. The Court finds defense counsel had no evidence to rebut, that by a preponderance of the evidence defendant is a risk of flight and defendant is a danger to the community. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg,CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Hilda Gutierrez, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br, ) (Entered: 10/04/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin : De Novo Bail Hearing as to Sandra I. Flores-Rivera held on 11/14/2007. Pretrial Services informed the Court that they verified the defendant's information with her daughter and that there are some conditions of release that could be imposed. Defense counsel argued in favor of setting conditions of release. The government argued in favor of detention without bail. The Court set bail at $30,000 secured by cash or property, with E/M, curfew from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM, employment, plus all other standard conditions of release. The defendant may not reside in or enter the Victor Berrios Public Housing Project. The defendant shall remain detained until bond is posted. The government's motions for reconsideration and for stay were denied. (AUSA Dina Avila. Atty Anita Hill-Adames. PTS Nancy Mendez. INT Hilda Gutierrez. CR FTR. CD Jyoti Mehta.) (jm) (Entered: 11/27/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Arraignment as to Andy W. Marcano-Alicea (24) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 held on 12/18/2007. AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Carlos Vazquez were present. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defendant remains under custody. Defense is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Janis Palma, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br) (Entered: 12/24/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Andy W. Marcano-Alicea held on 12/18/2007. AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Carlos Vazquez were present. The Government proffered the role and participation of the defendant. Defendant was concealing himself from the law enforcement officers and had intention to surrender after the holidays. The Government requested detention without bail. Defense counsel proffered that the mother is willing to post bail on his behalf, but complete information is not available. Counsel will reserve the right to reopen the matter of bail. After hearing the parties, the Court finds defendant to be a risk of flight and ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Order will follow. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Janis Palma, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br) (Entered: 12/24/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Bail Hearing as to Ramon Delgado-Rodriguez and Miguel A Arroyo-Arroyo held on 2/8/2008. AUSA Dina Avila and AUSA Jeannette Mercado and defense counsel Rafael Castro-Lang, Jose Aguayo and Juan R. Acevedo were present. The Court noted that no motion to withdraw from counsel Luis R. Rivera-Rodriguez has been filed and notice that counsel Castro-Lang has been retained. Defendant Delgado-Rodriguez expressed that his attorney is Rafael Castro-Lang and no longer Atty. Luis R. Rivera-Rodriguez. Attorney Aguayo also represents a co-defendant in the case and the Government believes that there may be a potential conflict of interest. The Court will set a Foster Hearing for 2/19/08. Testimony of Task Force S/A Victor Lopez was heard on behalf of the Government. Defense counsel Aguayo was heard by proffer. After viewing the evidence and hearing the testimony, the Court finds defendant not to be a flight risk. The Court is inclined to home detention and the wearing of an electronic monitoring device for defendant Arroyo-Arroyo. Information received from Probation Office, Pretrial Division, indicating that defendants with pacemakers are not eligible for the wearing or use of an electronic monitoring device. Therefore, defendant Arroyo-Arroyo is ordered detained without bail pending trial. A separate order will be issued. As to defendant Delgado-Rodriguez, Atty. Castro-Lang requested a continuance of the hearing for Monday. The Court granted the request. A Further Bail Hearing is set for 2/11/08 at 3:30 p.m. Govn't Exhs Adm.: 1 thru 5. Deft Arroyo's Exhs Adm.: A-C. (Exhibits kept by the Court.)(Court Reporter Barbara Dachman, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Edna Brayfield, PO: Jose Oben and Patricia Encarnacion) (br) (Entered: 02/11/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Maritza Maldonado and for defendant, Hector Deliz. Defendant is present in Court.Arraignment as to Roberto Torres-Camacho (39) Count 1,1s,2,2s,3,3s,4,45,5,5s,6,6s,7,10s held on 2/27/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Superseding Indictment. Defense counsel Hector Deliz informs the Court that a motion for reconsideration was filed on 2/25/08 (docket #584) and is heard. The Court, after hearing all counsel on their oral motions for reconsideration, vacates the order imposing sanctions as to all the attorneys that were sanctioned. Counsel are admonished to look carefully at notices, particularly in multi- defendant cases. The absence of attorneys in multi-defendant cases sometimes requires the Court to reschedule multiple hearings, thus unnecessarily protracting the proceedings. In its decision to vacate the sanctions imposed, the Court is taking into account that some attorneys have acknowledged candidly that they did receive notice, but that they might have overlooked the same, and that others have mentioned that due to the fact that this case has been managed in groups some inadvertent confusion may have arisen. Nevertheless, counsel are hereby put on notice that future absences of this nature may result in imposition of sanctions. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 03/04/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment as to Carmen Morales-Alvarez (41) Count 1,1s,2s,3,3s,4,4s,5,5s,6,6s,7,10s held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, Mr. Francisco Dolz, and court interpreter F. Toledo. Mr. Dolz stated for the record that his client was a bit lethargic due to medication received at MDC for depression. The Court inquired from defendant as to the medication and her knowledge as to why she was here and the accusation against her. The Court made a finding that at this time defendant was competent to understand proceedings, but recommended to Mr. Dolz that for other proceedings that be further inquired into. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial scheduling. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment as to Luis D Lebron-Trevecier (47) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,10 held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, Ms. Rosa Bonini and court interpreter Felix Toledo. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial scheduling. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Carmen Morales-Alvarez held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, Mr. Francisco Dolz, PTO Wendy Moreno and court interpreter Felix Toledo. Mr. Dolz stated for the record that at this time they had nothing to offer as to bail, but that they were reserving the right to reopen if information arose. The Court adopted the recommendations made by PT and ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Luis D Lebron-Trevecier held on 5/13/2008. The Court adopted the recommendations made by PT and set bail in the amount of $40,000.00 cash or secured, defendant is to reside with his parents, PT may impose a curfew if it so deems  necessary, employment, plus all other standard conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: De Novo Bail Hearing as to Carmen M. Flores-Rivera held on 6/19/2008. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Bail Revocation Hearing as to David Bermudez-Colon held on 6/23/2008. Present were AUSA Myriam Fernandez and defense counsel John Ward. The Court informed defendant a motion was filed by the Probation office, informing violation of conditions of release and the lack of compliance with the conditions. The defense counsel informed the Court they are not contesting the allegations of the motion, but defendant did not have time to take care of some family matters before being arrested. The Government requested defendant remains detained pending trial as he is also looking at local charges and now has two cases pending, and is a risk of flight. Defense counsel requested defendant be given some time to fix family matters, because he was not aware of his warrant for arrest when he came for the appointment with Probation Services. The Government requested that due to the two cases pending, defendant be kept detained pending trial, as he is a danger to the community. After listening the parties the Court is Revoking bail to the defendant, as he did not comply with the bail conditions given in regard to the substances abuse issue and ordered defendant to continue detained pending trial for being a risk of flight and a danger to the community. (PTO Liliana Mendez, CI Hilda Gutierrez and CD Elba Rivas) (Court Reporter FTR.) (er) (Entered: 06/24/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:De Novo Bail Hearing as to Ramon Berrios-Rojas held on 7/16/2008. AUSA-Dina Avila and attorney Guillermo Macari were present. Zoraida Correa-Pagan and Maria Berrios Velez gave testimony on behalf of the defendant. Parties presented their positions. After taking into consideration the testimony and arguments presented, the Court entered findings DENYING defendant's request for bail. The Court found that the defendant did not present new evidence to overturn the Magistrate-Judge's findings in this case. Therefore, defendant was ordered detained without bail. The Court found that there exists no condition or combination of conditions which would guarantee the safety of the community and prevent defendant from being a flight risk. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle; Court Interpreter Annie Flores) (ja) (Entered: 07/16/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Bail Hearing as to Cruz Roberto Ramos-Gonzalez held on 4/20/2009. AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Juan Acevedo-Cruz and Francisco Acevedo-Padilla were present. Defendant was present and under custody. The Government proffered the role and/or participation of the defendant and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel Juan Acevedo proffered that relatives were present in court and are willing to post bail. Counsel requested that bond be set in the amount of $250,000, and that standard release conditions, home detention and electronic monitoring device be imposed. Present were SAUSA Eugenio Lomba and Ms. Esther Castro. The USM didn't produce defendant Delgado-Davila until 3:00 p.m., reason for which foster hearing couldn't start on time. The Court advised the defendants as to possible conflicts which may arise in the future when two or more defendants in the same case are represented by the same counsel. After having been admonished by the Court, both defendants reiterated their wish to be represented by the same counsel. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: AUSA-Dina Avila, attorneys Esther Castro-Schmidt & Luis R. Rivera and USPO-Victor Carlo were present. Prior to the sentencing hearing scheduled for today, 5/26/2010, as to Cruz Roberto Ramos-Gonzalez, parties met with the Court in chambers. Parties stated their positions regarding the enhancement for obstruction of justice. Defense counsel expressed their concern as to certain sentencing issues which they need to bring to the Court's attention prior to sentencing this defendant. Yesterday attorney Castro filed a motion, Dkt# 2298, requesting a continuance of today's sentencing hearing and apprising the Court as to their concerns and motions pending. After taking into consideration arguments by counsel, and the fact that an Evidentiary Hearing has been scheduled for 6/8/2010 on defendant's request for New Trial, today sentencing hearing is  continued SINE DIE. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: FinalBail Revocation Hearing as to Juan G. De-Jesus-Mercado held on 6/25/2010. AUSA-Dina Avila and attorney Ramon Garcia-Garcia were present. The defendant did not contest the matters included in motions filed by the US Probation Officer on June 17 and 18, 2010. Defendant waived the final bail revocation hearing. Muinute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 1/28/2011 for Angel Luis Neris-Ruiz (4). AUSA-Dina Avila and attorney Juan Alvarez-Cobian wer present. Objections and rulings to the PSR were stated for the record. Defendant submitted his allocution for the record; same to be filed once translated. Defense counsel apprises the Court of his concern regarding the government's 851 Notice. After taking into consideration arguments by the parties, the Court made reference to the transcript of the COP hearing and found that defendant was properly advised of the 851 Notice and of its consequences prior to entering a plea of guilty in this case. Count(s) 1, 10s, 2, 2s, 3, 3s, 4, 4s, 5, 5s, 6, 6s, 7, Dismissed; Count(s) 1s, Impr for a term of 20 years. SRT of 10 yrs and SMA of $100.00. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 11:00.Hearing ended at 12:05. (ja) Modified on 4/12/2011 to add docket entry information. (re) (Entered: 02/02/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 1/28/2011 for Jose Manuel Zavala-Marti (2). ASUA-Dina Avila and attorney Maria Sandoval were present. The Court issued rulings as to pending objections to the PSI. Parties stated their positions as to the sentence to be imposed. The Court stated findings and basis for the sentence imposed. Count(s) 1, 10s, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, Dismissed; Counts 1s and 3s-6s: Impr for the remainder of his natural life. SRT of 10 years and SMA of $100.00 as to each count. Count(s) 2s,7s,8s & 9s: Impr for the remainder of his natural life. SRT of 3 years. SMA of $100.00 as to each count. All SRT to be served concurrently with each other. Deft will be given credit for any days spent in federal custody. Defense counsel argued reconsideration for the sentence imposed. Reconsideration and request to vacate sentence were deniedl. Objections were preserved  for the record. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 12:05.Hearing ended at 01:25. (ja) (Entered: 02/04/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: Case called for sentencing hearing as to Sandra I. Flores-Rivera on 1/28/2011, but same was not held. AUSA-Dian Avila and attorney Anita Hill. Defense counsel has filed a motion requesting an extension of time to file a response to the government's 851 Notice. Defendant intends to challenge her prior conviction and therefore needs an extension of time to obtain her criminal record in the state court. Defense counsel admitted that due to her lack of diligence this motion was filed tardy. The government stated their position for the record. The Court GRANTED defendant's request and rescheduled today's sentencing hearing. Motions terminated as to Sandra I. Flores-Rivera: 2569 MOTION for Extension of Time to File document Response to I filed by Sandra I. Flores-Rivera. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Competency Hearing as to Yeska Flores-Rivera held on 2/29/2012. AUSA-Dina Avila and attorney Robert Millan were present. Dr. Margarida has supplemented her evaulation due to a change in defendant's competency finding her competent to stand trial, although remains silent as to her defense. Defendant does not assist counsel in her defense. Defense counsel informed that he received a written plea agreement recently which he just began to discuss with his client. After meeting at sidebar with counsel, the Court granted defense counsel time to interview the defendant at the Marshal's interview area and review the plea agreement. After the recess, defense counsel requested additional time to confer with his client. The Court granted attorney Millan until March Ist at 5:00 PM to inform the results of said meeting. Notice of Compliance Deadline due by 3/1/2012. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 10:50.Hearing ended at 11:45.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (ja) (Entered: 03/08/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 3/16/2012 for Carlos Omar Bermudez-Torres (3). AUSA-Dina Avila and attorney Fernando Carlo were present. Objections to the PSI were stated for the record and rulings were issued. Defense counsel requested a concurrent sentence and moved the Court for a variance. Arguments heard. Allocution by defendant heard. After taking into consideration arguments by the parties, sentence was imposed: Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed; Count 10s, Order of Forfeiture in a sum equal to $10,000,000.00; Count(s) 1s, 2s, 3s, 4s, 5s, 6s, Impr for a term of 480 months as to Counts One and Three to Six, and 240 months as to Count Two, to be served concurrently with each other. SRT of 10 years as to Counts One and Three to Six, and for a term of 3 years as to  Count Two to be served concurrently with each other. A SMA of $100.00 as to each count, for a total of $600.00. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:00.Hearing ended at 02:45 Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (ja) Modified on 4/30/2012 to edit text (cm). (Entered: 03/23/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 4/25/2012 for Cruz Roberto Ramos-Gonzalez (1). AUSA-Dina Avila-Jimenez and attorneys Esther Castro-Schmidt & Luis Rivera-Rodriguez were present. Defendant's motion for continuance of today's sentencing hearing at Dkt 2877-DENIED.  Govt is granted 30 days to respond to Emergency Motion at Dkt# 2876; motion to be partially unsealed. Govt's Motion in Limine (#2870) granted in part, denied in part. The Court will allow the testimony of Dr Lopez de Victoria, but will not allow him to testify as to his spiritual relationship with the defendant. Testimony of Dr Orlando Lopez de Victoria on behalf of deft heard. Allocution by defendant heard. Sentence imposed: Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, of the First Indictment were Dismissed; Count 10s - Order of Forfeiture in the amount of $3,000,000.00 entered; Counts Is, 3s, 4s, 5s and 6s- Impr for the remainder of his natural life as to Counts One, Three, Four, Five and Six, and to 240 months as to Count Two, to be served concurrently with each other, and concurrently with the sentence imposed in Criminal Case 07-262. SRT of 10 years as to each of Counts One, Three, Four, Five and Six and 3 years as to Count Two, to be served concurrently with each other. SMA of $100.00 as to each count, for a total of $600.00. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:50.Hearing ended at 12:50.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (ja) (Entered: 04/30/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Elvin Andino- Velazquez (35) was held on 8/21/2012. Present: AUSA Julia Diaz, Atty Vladimir Mihailovich, PO Brenda Nieves and Interpreter Annie Flores. Defendant waived the hearing and accepted having committed the violations. The Court, after hearing the parties, entered findings that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release as cited in the USPO's Motions filed on June 6, 2011 and March 14, 2012 and revoked the SRT imposed on January 3, 2008. Sentence imposed: Imprisonment for a term of 24 months to be served  consecutively with the sentence imposed in the Superior Court of Connecticut in criminal cases CR 14-651518 and H 14 H CR 11-0650503-S. No additional term of supervised release will follow. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 10:00 a.m., held at 10:31-10:42 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 08/22/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Wilfredo Ramos-Garcia held on 8/21/2013. AUSA-Dina Avila and AFPD-Thomas Trebilcock were present. The Court after discussing the matter with the USPO is convinced that deft's main problem is his current alcohol and drug abuse, as well as his unstable mental health situation. The Court does NOT revoke deft's SRT. Defendant is admonished of the consequences of future violations. Defendant was given a stern warning. Defendant's conditions were modified to include treatment for drugs and alcohol in the inpatient program extended for an additional thirty (30) days, plus psychological treatment. The remaining supervision conditions imposed on July 24, 2009 will remain the same. (Court Reporter Diane  Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 11:28.Hearing ended at 11:35.Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (ja) (Entered: 08/27/2013)

AUSA Justin Martin and AFPD Yasmin Irizarry were present. Defense counsel informed that defendant wish to waive the hearing. Based upon the waiver, the Court approved the waiver and found probable cause that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. The case is referred to the presiding Judge for a final revocation hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Alex Flores-Rivera (15) held on 7/7/2015. Present: AUSA Dina Avila and AFPD Jesus Hernandez. USPO Guillermo Arbona also present. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Government informs they are ready to present the testimony of Agent Alexander Reyes-Flores. However, clarifies that the victim, even though the subpoena was served, has failed to appear in court. Sidebar Conference held. Government is ready to proceed and the sworn testimony of Agent Reyes was heard on behalf of the Government. Cross-examination and brief redirect. Witness excused. Counsel for defendant has no witnesses. Final arguments heard on behalf of the parties. The Court made a finding of probable cause and the case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for the setting of a Final Revocation Hearing. AFPD Hernandez requests the transcript of today's proceedings and the notes taken from the agent and all other relevant documents. Within the next 2 weeks, the Government is to provide requested documents. However, the form requesting production of the transcript is to be filed accordingly. (Court Reporter FTR.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Luis G. Vazquez-Laureano (44) held on 10/7/2016. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, defense counsel Franco Perez substituting for Jesus Hernandez and USPO Emmanuel Maldonado. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Form. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rule 5 and 32.1 of the F.R.Cr.P.. The case was referred to Juan Perez- Gimenez,U.S. District Judge for the Final Revocation Hearing. As to bail, defense counsel requested that conditions of release be imposed to defendant pending the final revocation hearing. The Court granted the request and imposed the following conditions in addition to all the conditions of supervised release previously imposed: the defendant shall continue to reside with his mother and shall submit himself to a mental health evaluation. Treatment, if necessary, will be determined by the USPO. A curfew will be  established by the Probation Officer and he shall wear an electronic monitoring device. The defendant must present himself at the Probation Office on Tuesday, October 11, 2016 at 9:00 AM for the EMD to be installed. Failure to do so will entail the issuance of a warrant for his arrest. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 3:30 pm. Hearing ended at 3:36 pm. Interpreter Heidi Cazes. (cmd) (Entered: 10/07/2016)
WAIVER of Preliminary Hearing as to Luis G. Vazquez-Laureano (44). (cmd) (Entered: 10/17/2016)

Vazquez-Laureano (44) on 11/30/2016: Present were AUSA Dina Avila-Jimenez, and AFPD Jesus A. Hernandez. The defendant was present in court, under supervised conditions, and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court that instead of revocation, the defendant continue under supervised release, and under the conditions imposed during the Preliminary revocation hearing. The United States requested that defendant shall remain under the conditions previously imposed. The Court stated for the record all the violations incurred by the defendant during the term of supervised release. Hence, the Court made several findings, and revoked the defendant. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jean Carlos Medina-Flores (17) held on July 19, 2017. Present were AUSA Camille Garcia-Jimenez, and retained counsel Jorge L. Armenteros-Chervoni. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The defense argued for a term of Eight (8) months. The United States argued for a term of Fourteen (14) months. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed as stated at the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer at docket no. 3488. Hence, supervised release previously imposed on February 26, 2010 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Forty-Eight (48) months of imprisonment. Upon release from custody, the defendant was placed under supervised release term of Seven (7) years. Reconsideration requested was denied. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:42.Hearing ended at 12:09 Interpreter Edna Brayfield. USPO Guillermo Arbona. (om) (Entered: 07/20/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Luis G. Vazquez-Laureano (44) held on 8/10/2017. Present: AUSA Seth Erbe, AFPD Carlos Vazquez and PO Yaritza Feliciano. Defendant was present in court and assisted by court interpreter Olga Uribe. Testimony of USPO Yaritza Feliciano was heard on behalf of Government. Testimony of Zuleika Correa was heard on behalf of the defense. After hearing the testimony of the witnesses, the Court found probable cause that defendant failed to report for mental health treatment on 7/13/17 and as to the use of synthetic marijuana on 7/21/17 and found no probable cause as to the issue that defendant failed to report on 7/14/17. Matter referred to Judge Perez-Gemenez for final revocation hearing. Gov's Exhs. 1-2 and Deft's Exh. A were admitted. Defense counsel was granted 5 working days to submit a certified translation of Exhibit A. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Luis G. Vazquez-Laureano (44) held on August 25, 2017. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe, and AFPD Carlos E. Vazquez. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office. No probable cause was found by USM Lopez as to the allegation for failure to report for mental health treatment. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. After having heard both parties in this case, the Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term by using illegal controlled substances, and failing to report termination of employment as cited in the motion filed by the United States Probation Officer on July 24, 2017, and the supplemental motion filed on August 23, 2017. Therefore, the supervised release term imposed on October 2, 2009 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to a term of Thirty-Six (36) months. Supervised release for a term of Forty-Eight (48) months under the same supervised release conditions previously imposed. In addition, a special condition was added. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defense objected the term of imprisonment imposed. The Court made specific findings for the record on why the term of imprisonment was imposed. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:28.Hearing ended at 02:55. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. SUSPO Luis Encarnacion (om) (Entered: 08/29/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Hearing on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Pablo Junior Rivera-Sanchez held on March 21, 2018. Present were AUSA Nicolas Warren Cannon, and AFPD Laura I. Soto-Santiago. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations filed by the U.S. Probation Office at docket no. 3563 . The United States had no objections, that part of the conditions be included that defendant be provided treatment for his addiction. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The Court after having heard the parties, made a ruling that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release as stated at the motions filed at docket 3563 , and hence Supervised release term imposed on January 4, 2012 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Time Served with a Supervised Release term of Twenty-Four (24) months. As part of the Supervised Release terms, the defendant shall participate in an outpatient substance abuse program for a period of at least Six (6) months under the terms and conditions recommended by the U.S. Probation Office. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defendant was strongly forewarned that any other violation to comply with the supervised release terms, warrant will be issued for his arrest, and once arrested shall be brought for a revocation hearing to be held by Judge Perez-Gimenez, and he may be sentenced to a statutory term of imprisonment. 2018. Present were AUSA Marc S. Chattah, and AFPD Victor J. Gonzalez-Bothwell for AFPD Vivian A. Torralbas. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Wilfredo Ramos-Garcia (36) held on 12/27/2018. Present: AUSA Kelly Zenon, AFPD Hector L. Ramos, USPO Yaritza Vazquez. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Counsel for defendant informed that they are waiving the hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause. Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. Defense counsel requested permission from the Court to present arguments for defendant's release pending final revocation hearing. The Court stated that according to Order #3627, any request for release will be decided by the Presiding Judge. AFPD Ramos argued that according to Rule 32.1, this Court is allowed to consider the matter of release or detention, setting the burden on defendant's side. Defendant's objection to Order #3627 was noted for the record. As reconsideration, defense counsel requested that a report and recommendation be issued in regards to defendant's release. Government has no objection for defendant's release to an in-patient treatment pending final revocation hearing. The Court noted parties' agreement for defendant's release, and is inclined to adopt the recommendation, but is prohibited to do so by the Order entered as part of Docket 3627. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 9.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 11:22.Hearing ended at 11:28.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (dv) (Entered: 01/03/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Victor L. Fontanez-Vazquez (31) held on 2/9/2021 by VTC. Present: AUSA Corinne Cordero and AFPD Victor Miranda. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Angelica Rodriguez also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to revocation, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense informed they will not contest the violations, as so informed by the Supervising US Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation heard on behalf of the defense. Requested Court revoke defendant to time served and no further SRT. Defendant's allocution heard. Government requested SRT be revoked, 6 months of  imprisonment be imposed and SRT of 3 months. After hearing defendant's allocution, defense counsel requested Court consider time served with SRT of 5 months to afford defendant to continue in a drug rehabilitation treatment. SRT revoked. IMPR: Time served. SRT of one (1) year. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 9:30 a.m. Hearing held at 9:15 a.m. Hearing ended at 9:55 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 02/09/2021)
THIRD JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Victor L. Fontanez- Vazquez (31). IMPR: Time served. SRT of one (1) year. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 2/9/2021.(sr) (Entered: 02/09/2021)
